title: TIPS TO MAKE IT WORK BEST FOR YOUR FOUNDATION PHASE
description: Leverage your curiosity by actively outlining the form and structure of passages during reading; use visual notes or diagrams to map transitions and paragraph purposes, keeping sessions dynamic and engaging to maintain focus.

Turn vocabulary practice into an interactive game by annotating challenging words with context clues and creating flashcards that include synonyms, antonyms, and example sentences to deepen understanding and sustain your enthusiasm.

Build your command of evidence skills by pairing up with a study buddy to discuss and identify the strongest textual support for answers, using active reading and annotation to make evidence hunting a collaborative and stimulating challenge.

Visualize nonlinear functions by sketching graphs during study sessions and breaking down problems into small, creative challenges; use timers to focus in short bursts and celebrate each successful solution to keep motivation high.

Approach linear functions by translating word problems into equations with clear, step-by-step diagrams or tables; set short, timed goals for each problem to harness your energy and maintain consistent progress without losing focus.

Strengthen your skills with systems of linear equations by practicing with real-world scenarios and working alongside an accountability partner to review and verify solutions, ensuring steady effort and preventing distraction through structured collaboration.
